title: Ticket #394: advertise pid and working directory of job
description:
Dear Condor team.

As part of pseudo-interactive monitoring, I am sending a second job to the same worker node as the first one.

However, when on the worker node, I have no clue what is the PID of the first job, nor what is the working directory of it.

I thought about publishing this information in the machine ClassAd, but I cannot find a way to do this. It seems that job-specific system information is not available right now?

Would it be possible to add them? What I would like to have is (by decreasing priority): 1) job working directory 2) PID of the job (or the head PID of a process tree) 3) PID of the starter

And ideally I would like to be able to publish those in the slot ClassAd.

Thanks, Igor
remarks:
2009-Aug-12 10:06:46 by smoler:
Another condor-users post(s), from Matt Hope, requesting this:

I would love it if you would publish the location in the classad.

Heck even local to the current box would do, drive letter warts and all I can deal with this in code with consistent share structures.

Matt

-----Original Message-----

From: Matthew Farrellee Sent: 10 August 2009 16:59 To: Condor-Users Mail List

Subject: Re: [Condor-users] Getting the output and error logs for an executing job

Horvatth Szabolcs wrote: Hi Matt, If you want to get data about a running job and don't want to have that data transferred to the schedd, you might try connecting to the machine where the job is running and looking at the data. condor_q -run x.y will show you where job x.y is running. 

  Yes, this is what I used to do with windows but its a bit fiddly finding
  the proper condor work directory. And with linux its seems even trickier
  from a windows machine.

Ahh yes. I don't think the local execute directory is published anywhere.
